meanings.definition: The act of pushing something beneath or below another object.
meanings.sent1: The underthrusting of the book under the bed was done carefully.
meanings.sent2: The underthrusting of the key under the doormat is a common hiding spot.
meanings.sent3: I tried underthrusting the broccoli under the mashed potatoes, but it didn't fool anyone.
meanings.sent4: The underthrusting of the sun beneath the horizon marks the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: The underthrusting of the roots into the soil ensures the plant's stability.

meanings.definition: The process of forcing something downwards or underneath.
meanings.sent1: The underthrusting of the ball into the basket was a perfect shot.
meanings.sent2: During the storm, the underthrusting of the waves against the shore caused erosion.
meanings.sent3: The underthrusting of the cookie into the milk made it deliciously soggy.
meanings.sent4: The underthrusting of the idea into his mind sparked a new perspective.
meanings.sent5: The underthrusting of the roots into the ground provides stability to the tree.

meanings.definition: A geological process in which one tectonic plate is pushed beneath another.
meanings.sent1: The underthrusting of the oceanic plate beneath the continental plate causes earthquakes.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the underthrusting of plates to understand the movement of the Earth's crust.
meanings.sent3: The underthrusting of the sandwich into the lunchbox made it hard to close.
meanings.sent4: The underthrusting of the iceberg beneath the water's surface is deceptive of its true size.
meanings.sent5: The underthrusting of the tectonic plates creates mountain ranges over millions of years.
